page.title: 08Education in Rode.
page.content: A playgroup on Tuesday and Thursday mornings provides pre-school education for children from three years old. Some then go on to the many private schools near Bath, but the majority go to Rode Methodist First School. Pupils also travel from other villages. The school takes boys and girls aged four to nine. Built in 1860, it has recently been beautifully modernised and extended. There are 63 pupils in three classes, who learn in groups. There are two teachers and a Head (who teaches for 70% of the time). The Christian traditon of the school is reflected in morning assembly and daily prayers. Older pupils travel to Selwood Middle School, Frome, and transfer at 13 to Frome College. Children with special educational needs are taken by minibus to Frome.
